author: Retail Technology Review
title: SATO and Datalogic join forces in EMEA to offer complete scanner-to-printer solutions
text:
Send to friend 
SATO, the global provider of Auto-ID solutions that empower workforces and streamline operations, and Datalogic, the automatic data capture and industrial automation solutions provider, have signed a sales agreement in EMEA to offer scanner-to-printer solutions to customers across retail, transportation & logistics, industrial, manufacturing and healthcare sectors. 
A world-class producer of bar code readers, mobile computers, sensors, vision systems and laser marking systems, Datalogic offers innovative solutions for a full range of applications. Its products are used in over a third of the world's supermarkets, as well as in POS (point of sale), airport, shipping and postal service applications. 
"SATO and Datalogic share a strong commitment to developing innovative solutions that take ease-of-use and efficiency to the next level. They also manufacture complementary products and share common customers across similar markets," comments Tetsushi Kondo, Managing Director of SATO Europe. "With this in mind, we felt that working with Datalogic would help us be more responsive to our customers' needs while strengthening our sales strategy in Europe". 
"We are excited to be partnering with SATO, a leader in labelling solutions with a strong presence in all our target markets," comments Giulio Berzuini, Vice President and General Manager at Datalogic. "This agreement will provide us with the opportunity to offer comprehensive solutions to our customers and meet their diverse needs across a variety of applications".
